newsitem.title: MEXICO: Synkro SA gives options to debtholders.
newsitem.headline: Synkro SA gives options to debtholders.

text.p: Synkro SA said that its debtholders were given two options at a recent meeting on the restructuring of its debt.

The options were presented during a bondholders meeting held December 23, it said in information given to the Mexican stock exchange. Company officials, however, were not immediately available to outline what the options were.
Banco International and GBM said the terms of the restructuring will be the same as those worked out for payments on its $50 million Eurobond that came due on October 7, 1995.

"The representatives of Banco International and Grupo Bursatil Mexicano, acting for the debtholders, said that the chosen option will remain subject to the conditions that the assets of the issuers (Synkro) will not be taxed and on the final acceptance of the Eurobond," Synkro said.
At the end of the third quarter, the company had outstanding debts of 3.856 billion pesos.
